intro: Alsine patula var. pitcheri, commonly known as the Pitcher's alsike, is a flowering plant native to the central and northern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in prairies and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by narrow, elongated pods containing seeds.
